item.title: Upcoming Free Games
item.description:
Gaming is expensive. Whether someone prefers consoles or PC, they will need to invest a fair amount of cash just to set up their stations. Once the hardware is ready to go, owners will need to turn to their platform's libraries to pick up some software. Nowadays, Xbox Game Pass and PS Plus grant access to massive selections of games for monthly fees; however, most AAA titles do not debut on these subscription services. Consequently, players could find themselves regularly dropping $69.99, at a minimum, to experience the latest exciting projects.

Free-to-play games sound fantastic on paper and can serve as a way to keep someone entertained in between premium products. Plenty of titles showcase this model's potential, and this selection is set to expand significantly over the coming months and years. What are the most highly anticipated new free games announced for the last months of 2025 or beyond? At the moment, there are not all that many no-cost projects with confirmed release dates; however, several games are in the pipeline, and they could very well debut over the next few months.

Updated September 3, 2025 by Mark Sammut: Rather than focusing on the "beyond" part, we have added three upcoming 2025 free games . They all look pretty great or, at least, interesting.

Dragon Ball Gekishin Squadra

Dragon Ball Gets A Free MOBA

Dragon Ball Gekishin Squadra
Action
MOBA
Systems
Released
September 9, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Ganbarion
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, PlayStation 4, Nintendo Switch, PC, Mobile
Powered by

OK, this announcement came as a surprise. New Dragon Ball games come out every other year, but the franchise has never glanced at MOBAs, let alone produced a free-to-play project designed to compete in that cutthroat genre. As unexpected as this move is, Dragon Ball has been attempting to diversify its gaming portfolio recently, and multiplayer-driven games seem to be a priority.

Perhaps inspired by The Breakers ' relative failure, Dragon Ball Gekishin Squadra will be free, in an effort to establish a player base as soon as possible. Gameplay-wise, the game appears to follow fairly typical MOBA guidelines, including round-based matches, evolutions, and defined roles. Matches will consist of 4v4, and there should be roughly 20 playable characters at launch.

Arena Breakout: Infinite

A Free Extraction Shooter That Prioritizes Realism

Arena Breakout: Infinite
Extraction
FPS
Systems
Released
September 15, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Morefun Studios
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Arena Breakout: Infinite has been steadily building up momentum over the last 18 months, starting with a close beta in May 2024. The game is also on mobile devices, but its full release will happen on Steam and Epic on September 15, 2025. The extraction shooter genre is in a bit of a weird spot, as while there are not all that many options, new releases struggle to make their mark in a landscape dominated by Escape from Tarkov .

Arena Breakout: Infinite seems set to be an exciting free alternative to that polarizing game, offering a focus on tactics, realism, and customization. Squad runs will probably be the game's bread and butter, but solo plays should be viable as well. With maps that require different strategies and unpredictable weather, this title could be quite good. That said, the game's beta and past versions garnered mostly mixed receptions, so I would recommend sticking to cautious optimism.

Where Winds Meet

A Free Open-World Action RPG

Where Winds Meet
Action RPG
Wuxia
Open-World
Systems
Released
November 14, 2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Everstone Studios
Platform(s)
Android, iOS, PC, PS5
Powered by

You ever see an upcoming free game that just seems too good to be true? Well, Where Winds Meet is one of those examples. Here is a game with a vast open-world, flashy combat, and a rich setting based on China's Five Dynasties and Ten Kingdoms, a period that has barely been explored by the industry.

Where Winds Meet falls within the Wuxia category, which focuses on martial arts that often utilize weapons. This inspiration is evident in the game, which has seven weapons that each come with unique skills. Where Winds Meet looks gorgeous and seems to play like a dream, at least from the footage that has been released. The game has been out for a while in China, but its Western debut is scheduled for November 2025.

Path Of Exile 2

Sequel To One Of The Best Free Games

Path of Exile II
Action RPG
Systems
9 /10

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Grinding Gear Games
Engine
Proprietary Engine
Multiplayer
Online Multiplayer, Online Co-Op
Early Access Release
December 6, 2024
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Grinding Gear's Path of Exile enjoyed its 10th anniversary in 2023, and the game is still among the best free-to-play options on the market. Presented as an alternative to Diablo , the isometric action RPG delivers stellar customization, gameplay, and a lot of content that can be enjoyed without requiring any cash investment. Path of Exile prides itself on not being pay-to-win, and the developer has generally stuck to that commitment. Now, the sequel is on the horizon, and it is shaping up to be an exciting expansion of an already beloved hack and slash dungeon crawler.

Generally, when an upcoming free project vows to deliver the stars and moon, skepticism should be the natural reaction; however, Grinding Gear's words are backed by years of generally good work. Therefore, when Path of Exile 2 's Steam description promotes a six-act campaign and extensive endgame content in the form of 100+ maps with unique boss fights, there is a chance that the final product might actually deliver on these promises.

On December 6, 2024, Path of Exile 2 entered early access, becoming available on PC, PS5, and Xbox Series X. While the full game will be free-to-play, the early access version is not; consequently, PoE2 is still an upcoming free game .

Tom Clancy's The Division: Resurgence

Mobile Third-Person Shooter

Tom Clancy's The Division Resurgence
Open-World
Tactical
Action
Third-Person Shooter
Systems
Released
2025

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Ubisoft
Engine
Unreal Engine 4
Multiplayer
Online Multiplayer
Platform(s)
Android, iOS
Powered by

While Ubisoft canceled Heartland , a free-to-play The Division game that was fairly hyped up for a while, the publisher seems set to release a mobile game set in the same universe. Resurgence looks to adapt the franchise's MMO structure for Android and iOS devices, delivering similar third-person shooter gunplay, missions, exploration, and loot. Returning to New York, the setting for the first game in the series, the upcoming free game will also feature an open-world that supports both PvE and PvP content, with the latter coming courtesy of the Dark Zone. The former will include a brand-new campaign and storyline that focuses on the early days of the virus' spread, casting players as early members of the Strategic Homeland Division.

Going on the beta footage released so far, Tom Clancy's The Division: Resurgence looks pretty promising, especially for a mobile device. While the pre-release gameplay shows some stutter, that could be ironed out by the time the final product launches; even then, the game still looks good in its current state. The Division has kind of a weird reputation. Despite not being as talked about as some other live-service projects like Destiny 2 , the franchise has been largely successful, and The Division 2 is still quite active.

Arknights: Endfield

Landing On PC

Arknights: Endfield
Action
RPG
Action RPG
Strategy
Base Building
Systems
Developer(s)
Hypergryph

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Engine
Unity
Platform(s)
Android, iOS, PC, PlayStation 5
Powered by

Debuting in 2019 on mobile devices, Arknights is nowadays well established as one of the industry's most famous projects. It was even successful enough to warrant an anime adaptation, and the franchise looks set to continue its expansion with a spin-off game set on a new planet. Endfield Industries has taken measures to bring civilization to Talos-II, but the world and its locals have been less than welcoming. Set following a disaster that greatly hurt this movement, players step into the shoes of PFRD operatives tasked with taming the alien planet.

Arknights: Endfield looks set to be fairly different from the mainline entry. For one, the spin-off will utilize real-time strategy combat, although exact details on the system's mechanics have yet to be provided. It is also unclear whether the game will employ gacha mechanics, although that seems likely. More importantly, Endfield will be available on PC, an ecosystem that Arknights has yet to target specifically.

Crosswind

An MMO Survival Pirate Adventure

5 Images
5 Images
Crosswind
MMO
Survival
Exploration
RPG
Systems
Developer(s)
Crosswind Crew

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

The world could always use a few more pirate-themed projects, and Crosswind looks perfect on paper. A survival MMO set during the Age of Piracy, aka the 18th century, the game promises a well-rounded experience that supports PvE single-player and, naturally, PvP multiplayer.

Going by the Steam description, the story starts with the player's captain being left for dead, a strong inciting incident for both a survival game and a revenge story. After that, players will likely get to explore the open sea and various islands, all the while building their crew. As always, cautious optimism is advised for upcoming free games , especially ones that are absurdly exciting. Still, Crosswind is setting the stage for a public alpha test, so things are moving along nicely.

The Hidden Ones

Martial Arts Anime Fighter

The Hidden Ones
Fighting
Systems
Developer(s)
Morefun Studios

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Multiplayer
Online Co-Op, Online Multiplayer
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Set within the universe of Hitori no Shita (aka The Outcast or Under One Person ), The Hidden Ones is a martial arts fighting game that looks pretty interesting at a glance. As free-to-play arena fighters are pretty rare, this one has the potential to corner a niche market. The source material is not extremely well known outside of China, but it is popular enough to spawn five anime seasons, so there is a desire to see this IP expanded upon. While online multiplayer will be a selling point, The Hidden Ones seems set to also include a story mode, which would be a big bonus for this type of release.

Karlson

Made For Speed-Runners

3 Images
3 Images
Karlson
FPS
Action
Platformer
Systems
Developer(s)
Dani

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Dani has two successful free games under their belt: Muck and Crab Game . Both titles focus on physics-based gameplay, and they are fairly impressive considering they largely stemmed from the mind of a single person. Dani's next project is Karlson , a first-person shooter that heavily incorporates parkour and speed-running. The eponymous character is a prisoner who must wall-jump and blast their way through a series of levels en route to a glass of milk.

The creator's resume and social media presence ensure Karlson would get some attention, but the game also presents a convincing case for meriting this hype. A version of the project can be downloaded for free on Itch.io, and it is quite good.

Neverness To Everness

Open-World Gacha RPG

Neverness to Everness
Action RPG
Open-World
Systems
Developer(s)
Hotta Studio

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Engine
Unreal Engine 5
Platform(s)
PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X and Series S, Microsoft Windows
Powered by

Hotta Studio's Neverness To Everness has been quietly attracting hype, garnering interest due to its seemingly ambitious combination of action JRPG combat and a GTA -style open-world. It also includes gacha mechanics, which seem to be a requirement for these types of releases in this day and age. Honestly, on paper, Neverness To Everness seems almost too good to be true, especially since the developer is fairly unknown; that said, Hotta released a 13-minute gameplay showcase video that does a pretty good job of highlighting the game's world and combat. If nothing else, this free RPG at least appears to genuinely exist and seems to be developing nicely.

Neverness To Everness is slated to debut on mobile devices, PC, and PS5, which is quite a diverse platform slate. Nowadays, iOS and Android devices are capable of running AAA-level games, even ones that are being created in Unreal Engine 5. Obviously, it is still way too early to predict whether this project will be a success or not, but the early signs are positive enough to warrant keeping an eye on Neverness To Everness . It would be cool to have another great free action JRPG that is not developed by MiHoYo.

Paradise

The AI Era Is Coming

Paradise
Open-World
Action
Adventure
Simulation
Systems
ESRB
T For Teen // Violence, Mild Language

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Developer(s)
Ultra Games
Multiplayer
Online Co-Op, Online Multiplayer
Platform(s)
PC, PlayStation 5, Xbox Series X, Xbox Series S
Powered by

Love or hate it, AI is here to stay and will almost certainly become a major part of video game design moving forward. Paradise seems set to take advantage of this technology, using it to create an open-world where NPCs are more than just no-name figures with no identity beyond their set cycle. The idea is that AI will enable players to interact with NPCs in far greater detail than usual, with the latter having full lives that are automatically generated.

The concept is ambitious and could pave the way to more realistic worlds than ever before, ones that could (potentially) offer endless possibilities. Beyond this selling point, Paradise does not appear to have much of a story, at least not one that is being highlighted at the moment. Perhaps, the developers are primarily seeking to create a slice of life-type experience where players can just go about their day, enjoying unique activities as they mess about in the world.

Sonic Rumble

A Party Game With Up To 32 Players

Sonic Rumble
Battle Royale
Systems
Developer(s)
Sonic Team, Rovio

Platform(s)
Mobile, PC
Powered by

An argument could be made that the best Sonic the Hedgehog game of the last five years is a freebie that was randomly dropped on Steam. The Murder of Sonic the Hedgehog is shockingly good and an easy recommendation for fans of the franchise, as long as they do not mind a story-driven visual novel. As that worked so well, Sega looks set to dip into the free market once again, albeit with a very different project. Sonic Rumble is a 32-player multiplayer party game that seems to take a few lessons from Fall Guys , with players competing in races and other survival-themed modes. Naturally, players will have access to a plethora of characters from across the franchise, beyond just the obvious ones like Sonic, Knuckles, and Tails.

While probably better to not get too excited until more information is revealed regarding its Western release, which seems set to not include gacha mechanics, Sonic Rumble should be a fun time. Fall Guys might no longer be at its peak popularity, but there is really nothing wrong with its core concept and gameplay loop; furthermore, Sega has the resources and the pedigree to push this peculiar multiplayer subgenre to the next level.

Vaultbreakers

Extraction Action-RPG

5 Images
5 Images
Vaultbreakers
Extraction
Action RPG
Looter Shooter
Systems
Developer(s)
BetaDwarf

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

Vaultbreakers has been making the rounds for a while, and the game followed a playtest in February 2025 with a second set between April 913. Played from an isometric angle similar to old-school action-RPGs, the title incorporates extraction gameplay, with players accepting short-ish missions where they must collect loot while facing off against other users and AI enemies.

While seemingly not devoid of lore, Vaultbreakers ' selling point appears to be character customization, replayability, and its range of champions (which act as classes). Unlike quite a few other upcoming free-to-play games , BetaDwarf's title is a bit more of a known quantity, and it has all the ingredients to be a memorable addition to the ARPG genre.

Special Mention: Deadlock

Not Confirmed To Be Free-To-Play, But Seems Likely

Deadlock
Shooter
MOBA
Systems
Developer(s)
Valve

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

Publisher(s)
Valve
Engine
Source2
Platform(s)
PC
Powered by

After roughly a year of rumors and undisclosed playtests, Valve finally acknowledged that Deadlock is a thing in August 2024. Despite having a Steam page and featuring a respectable active player count, the game is not currently available to try, with the only people playing are ones with special invitations. Furthermore, Valve has been very tight-lipped about the project, only revealing the bare minimum. Still, the available knowledge paints an exciting picture of a game that looks set to combine two popular free genres: MOBAs and hero shooters. The latter is fairly oversaturated nowadays and there is not much of a call for new representatives, but Valve certainly has the reputation and resources to craft an exception.

Now, Valve has not revealed that Deadlock will be free-to-play, so this mention is based purely on market and historical evidence. Except for Half-Life: Alyx , Valve seems to have mostly focused on free games over the last decade, at least whenever the developer decides to create something new. More importantly, Valve's multiplayer projects tend not to be buy-to-play, and there is no reason the publisher should change course and try something different at this point. Also, Concord 's swift termination might not encourage many publishers to go down the premium hero shooter route.

item.title: Helldivers 2: Destroy Spore Lung Mission Guide
item.description:
The release of Helldivers 2 's Into the Unjust update introduces a variety of new features: challenging new enemies like burrowing Rupture variants, the devious Dragonroach, and the nigh-unkillable Hive Lord; sprawling underground cave networks that prevent calling down stratagems; and of course, new mission types.

The new primary mission objective, Destroy Spore Lung, sends intrepid Helldivers underground to destroy a Terminid Spore Lung. Delving into Terminid caves is a daunting prospect on its own, even with the best weapons to venture underground, and the added stress of carrying a Portable Hellbomb on your back only increases the desperate feeling of the expedition. This guide will touch briefly on what you want to bring with you, as well as what exactly you'll need to do in order to destroy the Terminid Spore Lung in Helldivers 2 .

How to Destroy a Terminid Spore Lung

Terminid Spore Lungs are one of several primary objectives you'll encounter when dropping onto Gloom-infested planets. This objective tasks you with venturing into Terminid tunnels and deploying a Portable Hellbomb at the site of the Spore Lung itself.

On missions with this primary objective, the Portable Hellbomb backpack Stratagem will be a free stratagem for the mission.

Before venturing into the caves, make sure you're fully stocked with ammo and any gear you want to bring with you (more on gear choice in the next section). When you and your squad are ready, head into the caves. Be prepared for stiff resistance as you push further into the Terminid tunnels. You will encounter multiple bug holes down here, including the potential for Bile Titan Nests (which can be extra challenging when deprived of deployable Orbital or Eagle Stratagems). Destroy bug holes along the way, but as you go, make sure you are following the fleshy, orange tubes along the ceiling (shown in the image below). These are attached to the Spore Lung, so they act as your trail marker to the source.

Once you reach the terminus of these fleshy, orange tubes, you'll find a large glowing mass attached to the ceiling into which all the tubes are feeding. This is the Terminid Spore Lung. To destroy it, you'll want to activate the Portable Hellbomb directly beneath it . Once activated, unequip it and run out of there (or remain beneath it, emoting democratically in the face of annihilation). Even if you die at the Spore Lung, as long as you activated the Portable Hellbomb, you should be treated to an 'Objective Completed' alert.

One Portable Hellbomb should destroy the Spore Lung, though it will occasionally survive if the Portable Hellbomb isn't placed in the exact right spot .

If the Spore Lung survives, you can return to the surface to call down another Portable Hellbomb to finish the job. Alternatively, the Spore Lung can be destroyed by overwhelming explosive damage, though it's rarely optimal. For example, it can be destroyed by about 1012 shots from a Recoilless Rifle or Quasar Cannon . If the first Portable Hellbomb doesn't finish the job, but you have access to some other explosive options like Thermite, the Ultimatum (secondary), or Quasar Cannon, you can potentially destroy it with just a few more shots.

Best Weapons and Stratagems to Reach the Spore Lung

So, what you need to do is simple, but what's the best way to get it done? Without delving too deeply into squad loadouts, there are a few choice gear options that can help you on this mission. The big one is the Emancipator Exosuit . For those struggling to delve too deeply into the Terminid tunnels without getting overwhelmed, try bringing along a mech (or two). You can stomp most lesser bugs, close bug holes with its four Autocannons, and remain relatively safe on the journey to the Spore Lung. You're very likely to run out of ammo along the way, but it can act as a powerful stake to drive deep into the heart of the Terminid caves.

To compensate for the chance of one Portable Hellbomb not fully doing the trick, you can also bring along an Ultimatum, Quasar Cannon, and some Thermite to finish the job.

As far as helpful gear for the squad as a whole on this mission, there are several great options.

  • Primary : Cookout, Blitzer, Liberator Penetrator
  • Secondary : Ultimatum (especially critical if you come across a Bile Titan Nest along the way)
  • Grenade : Gas, Stun, Thermite
  • Stratagems : AX/TX-13 "Guard Dog" Dog Breath, Supply Pack, Machine Gun, Heavy Machine Gun, Grenade Launcher, Quasar Cannon

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: Where To Find the Shelter Key in Cronos: The New Dawn
item.description:
Cronos: The New Dawn does a great job of making the environments horrifying and unsettling. With every area being dark and dimly lit, players will often have to explore corners and rooms in constant fear of getting ambushed by the grotesque creatures that require multiple charged shots to defeat.

The game features multiple locked doors and gates that might require a specific key or code for access. Unlocking them can take time and isn't always clearly laid out, which can be confusing at times. Players who are confused as to where they can find the Shelter Key in Cronos: The New Dawn can check out the guide below.

Where To Find the Shelter Key in Cronos: The New Dawn

Soon after your first boss encounter, players will have to interact with the Dive Point to reach Edward 's apartment, where a note inside a locked safe will tell them about the Shelter . As you make your way down the apartment and exit through the front doors, you will come across a totally different landscape, which has snow falling everywhere and intact buildings. Once you go down to the fountain to your left, you will find the door of the Shelter .

From the Shelter door, turn around and go to the right of the Hardware Store , where you can follow the path and will soon find a cat that goes toward the alleyway on your right. Follow the cat and head down the stairs leading to the underground section of an apartment. To your right is a door leading to a room filled with a bunch of files, and to your left is a door locked by chains that you can open using the Boltcutter . Inside, you will find a valuable item and more resources.

Valuable items can be sold at any Workstation to get Energy, which is necessary for weapon upgrades.

Head down another staircase, which leads to a metal container that you can lift up and go to the other side. It is here that an enemy will burst out of unit 94 , and after dealing with it, interact with the item inside unit 94. You will acquire the Shelter Key , and soon after collecting it, more enemies will spawn. If you are low on ammunition and health, you can try to make a run for the metal container and push it to reach the other side, avoiding this encounter.

Once you go back outside, you can now open the door to the left, which leads to a playground where Karol , the cat, can be found. After interacting with this feline creature, head back to the Shelter door and unlock it to progress the story.

  • If you want to know what upgrades to get first in Cronos: The New Dawn , then check out our guide here.

item.title: Where to Find the Bolt Cutters in Cronos: The New Dawn
item.description:
When players start Cronos: The New Dawn , they'll come across several chained-up doors that require bolt cutters to open. While there won't be any just lying around, you'll naturally progress through the game until you come across a locked tool store with a missing key. Players will find the bolt cutters in the Jedrus tool store, but they'll have to head into a nearby apartment complex to get the key. Here's how players can find both the Jedrus hardware store key and the bolt cutters in Cronos: The New Dawn .

Jedrus Tool Store Key Location in Cronos: The New Dawn

While players are exploring the first area in Cronos: The New Dawn , they'll come across a locked tool/hardware store. It'll have a note on the side, hinting that the key might be located inside the block 34 building, apartment no. 29 . After reading the note, head towards the right side, through the double doors, and into the streets. You'll spot a building labeled 34 right in front of you that you'll need to enter to find apartment 29 and the tool store key.

After entering the building, there's a safe room to the right that you can use to save your game and manage your inventory. After that, head up the staircase, and you'll come across pulsating sacks with a green glow. Shoot these sacks before proceeding ahead, as they'll explode if you get close, spreading a pool of acid . Next, you'll need to shoot the barrel or use the Flamethrower to burn off the vines to progress further.

After interacting with two Time Oddities on the next floor, you'll reach the third floor. Here, you'll need to burn through two vine walls to reach apartment no. 29 at the end of the hallway. Once you head inside, clear the room of all enemies first. Once the coast is clear, head to the balcony and enter the room beside it through a wall outside. You'll find the Jedrus Tool Store key inside, on a table behind the wall.

How to Get the Bolt Cutters at the Tool Store

Once you return to the tool store, use the key to enter. You'll notice that the door to the back room, which contains the bolt cutters, is locked. To open the door, go around the room and see through the opening to spot a vine wall blocking the entryway. Shoot the canister on top of the shelves to burn the vines away.

Be careful, as when you try to open the door, a large enemy will burst out of it. You can quickly defeat the enemy with charged blasts from your shotgun. Once the enemy is defeated, head inside the back room, and you'll be able to grab the bolt cutters inside . Now, you'll be able to open all the chained doors in Cronos: The New Dawn .

item.title: Marvel Rivals Season 4 is Officially Adding Daredevil and Angela to the Roster
item.description:
Marvel Rivals has released a new trailer for Season 4: Heart of the Dragon, which confirms that both Daredevil and Angela are joining the game's roster of heroes. Marvel Rivals was an instant success when it launched late last year, with many hailing it as a worthy competitor to Blizzard's Overwatch . Enthusiasm for Marvel Rivals has waned somewhat since its explosive launch, but the game is still one of the most popular live-service titles on the market.

The Marvel Rivals player count is down from its peak, but the game is still holding strong thanks to a regular release of updates. New Marvel Rivals updates have made balance changes based on fan feedback, added new maps to battle it out on, and of course, introduced new heroes to select. Every season brings new characters for Marvel Rivals players to play as, and Season 4 will be no exception to the rule.

There has been much speculation about what Marvel Rivals Season 4 will be bringing to the table, but fans need wonder no more. It has now been confirmed that both Daredevil and Angela will be headlining the new season, set to start on Friday, September 12. The trailer revealing Daredevil and Angela for Marvel Rivals Season 4 is cinematic in nature, but does hint at their abilities. It seems Angela will use a spear and will have angelic-themed projectiles at her disposal, as well as the ability to bind her opponents. Daredevil, meanwhile, seems to have a dash ability in addition to his trusty billy clubs. It also looked like Daredevil "marked" Angela in some way because she had a red hand floating above her head at one point in the trailer, but I could be misinterpreting things. The good news is that with Marvel Rivals Season 4 right around the corner, a full rundown on each new heroes' ability kit should be released sooner rather than later.

When is Marvel Rivals Season 4?

  • Friday, September 12

Marvel Rivals has more DPS characters than it does any other category, so it will be interesting to see which classes Daredevil and Angela fall into. Based on the trailer, it seems likely that Daredevil will be a DPS and Angela will be a tank, but it's possible that they are both tanks. Time will tell on that front, but more information should come to light sooner rather than later.

Who is Angela?

Angela is not the most famous Marvel comics hero of all time, but she certainly has her fans, and her Marvel Rivals debut should raise her stock considerably. She originally appeared in Todd McFarlane's Spawn series, but was eventually sold to Marvel by Neil Gaiman. Angela is a powerful Asgardian and Thor's sister.

The Marvel Rivals roster has grown quite a bit since launch, so if you are someone that hasn't played since its big debut last December, there are plenty of new heroes to check out. Season 1 added the entire Fantastic Four and two new maps, while Season 2 added Emma Frost, Ultron, and the iconic Krokoa. The ongoing Season 3 added Phoenix and Blade, while Season 4 will feature the aforementioned Angela and Daredevil when it launches on September 12.
